Comments: “Never Again” is the first track, and third single, off of Nickelback’s third album, Silver Side Up.

The song tackles domestic violence through the perspective of a child. They see his mother being beaten by his drunk father with the mother telling them to go back to bed. The child has a hatred for their father, calling him a child with a temper and threatens to beat him for all the hurt he inflicted on their mother.
After a hospital visit and subsequent release, the mother finally has enough of the father’s antics and shoots him dead in self-defense when he goes to beat her again, putting an end to the beatings.
The single, released on July 2 2002, peaked at #1 on the Billboard Mainstream Rock Charts on October 5 2002 as well as charting in Canada, Ireland, Scotland, and the United Kingdom.
